alert.note: Alert for Orange; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 3:54PM EDT until July 07 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Orange County in central Vermont... South Central Washington County in central Vermont... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 354 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Barre, Montpelier, Williamstown, Barre City, Websterville, Barre Town, Berlin, Brookfield, Northfield, East Montpelier, Orange, Roxbury, Graniteville, South Barre, Ainsworth State Park, Upper Graniteville, Lower Websterville, East Barre, East Roxbury and Allis State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
